instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Caps Lock light
threads.message: The Caps Lock light on this board doesn't work. Caps lock works but no light. I have tried different keyboards and still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Caps Lock light
threads.message:
Liquid damage/corrosion, missing components?
-look at caps lock led drive circuit(<CHIP>U5830</CHIP> <TRANSISTOR>Q5736</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q5738</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5734</TRANSISTOR>)
-check continuity between pin 40 <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and pins 5&2 of <CHIP>U5730</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Caps Lock light
threads.message: Yes water damaged. My initial problem with the board was missing One wire 3,42V, but got that sorted. This board doesn't have any components of the LED drive circuit. I have already tried to replace <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Caps Lock light
threads.message: Really who cares about the cap lock LED? It is simply driven from <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, so either bad trace or resistor <RESISTOR>R5714</RESISTOR> or bad connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Caps Lock light
threads.message: I do :), Okey, thank you, I'll try the connector when I get back from my summer holiday. <RESISTOR>R5714</RESISTOR> is fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Caps Lock light
threads.message: Juts leave it and avoid any further complications.
